Beginner's guide to Monad Mainnet:

https://t.co/gOn61Ign6t

Monad mainnet is live. It is a brand new network with a brand new technology stack, freed from past debt and with a mission to grow crypto

Tech innovation + optimism + a relentless group of builders are why the Monad ecosystem will consistently improve. Let's do this 💪

Please let comment here with any isues you're experiencing on Monad mainnet

The whole team is helping to triage as a number of apps and integrations go live for the first time
Pretty consistently at 100-200 tps right now, so far so good

Great visual of what's going on on chain (this is MonadVision's USDC feed):

https://t.co/G4NtRBN2Ps

Monad's founding thesis is that decentralized systems have superpowers of resilience, trustlessness, and and resistance to central control. But they need to further scale.

The result is a unique network that's starting to accomplish this! Check out https://t.co/p2bnURw1Nt
A great visual https://t.co/06ba1Q7f4b
USDC deposits to and withdrawals from the Monad network are now live on Coinbase

18 hours into Monad mainnet, we've seen about 5 million transactions. Where's that activity coming from?

https://t.co/eBkncF0iiJ (@nad_radar) does a great job of showing what's going on

App Hub
https://t.co/cjoffVCxAX

More updates coming soon!

Still Day 2, lots more to do!

- Alchemy Pay, Banxa, Capa, Koywe, OSL Pay, Swapped, and Transak added onramp support for MON

- Tenderly added support

- @AccountableData went live with their first vault

- @Curvance went live!

- @YapdotMarket is live!

- @FolksFinance is

Day 3 of Monad Mainnet

It was a packed meeting day for me because I’d blocked Mon and Tue off for mainnet launch… so everything landed today

I’ll be back with an update Friday. Briefly: things are still very new and nascent, although it helps to have some of the top teams

Dear Monad builders,

The Monad mainnet, and your own protocol's mainnet, are live. Awesome! What's next?

First of all, congrats! This is a huge accomplishment. It required you to power through a lot of adversity, investor rejections, the uncertainty of mainnet timing,
Hit @buntyverse up https://t.co/a6ryltPthK

Native delegation (native staking) is part of the Monad protocol. This is different from Ethereum, where you have to use an LST to stake unless you want to run a validator yourself.

Epochs are every 50,000 blocks (~5.5 hours). Your delegation or undelegation actions take effect
https://t.co/Y6cT5WPpK3 by @gmonads
https://t.co/QABEc3BcxH by @blockvisionhq

Transaction simulation is supported on Monad in:
- @Backpack 
- @MetaMask
- @phantom

This way you can see the projected consequences of each transaction.

This is super nice, huge thank you to these teams (+ @blockaid_ under the hood in some cases) for making this happen!

eth_sendRawTransactionSync (EIP-7966) is live on testnet, and will go live on mainnet shortly

This allows developers to submit transactions and wait for a receipt instead of having to poll

More generally, version v0.12.3 is live on testnet, introducing
- a wire authentication
https://t.co/j6P3e8ZAni
It's time to build
We can stay optimistic and productive longer than you can remain grumpy

B-Harvest team built a system for capturing and replaying logs and network state from a Monad node, to get better insights into network behavior.

High performance systems are super cool. Thanks for building this, and excited for what insights and improvements arise from it! https://t.co/tWX33V7BHj

eth_sendRawTransactionSync RPC method is now available on Monad Mainnet

You can send a tx and receive its receipt under a second with a single call

As a result, viem's sendRawTransactionSync and sendTransactionSync work out-of-box for Monad

Here is an interesting markets puzzle: should someone trading a prediction market with 1% odds and $1 notional count toward $1 of volume, or $0.01?

To me it is clearly $0.01

To the guys in replies saying “but someone else staked 99c to take the other side”, I would add that https://t.co/MEWKJPDNDU

Vitalik's walkaway test is a wishlist for future-proofing Ethereum. This is a great scorecard; some features are live on Monad already, while others will require more development.
